0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Clear shipments through customs, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
Verify and document accurate details of imported or exported goods in relevant records and reports.
Negotiate with suppliers, carriers, and other stakeholders to resolve issues related to clearance and delivery.
Prepare and submit correct Harmonized System (HS) codes for duty calculation purposes.
Conduct market research to determine optimal export destination options for clients' products.
Maintain accurate records of client shipments, including tracking numbers, documentation, and delivery status.
Respond to inquiries from customs agencies and resolve any discrepancies or issues promptly.
Facilitate the entry of goods into the country by communicating with customs brokers and officials.
Calculate duties, taxes, and other applicable fees for imported goods on behalf of clients.
Update and implement changes to client documentation and procedures as required by regulations.
Coordinate inspections and audit visits from customs agencies and regulatory bodies.
Prepare necessary permits and licenses for export shipments, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Negotiate with carriers to ensure timely delivery of shipments and resolve any transportation issues.
Conduct on-site audits to verify accuracy of shipment details and documentation.
Advise clients on the requirements and procedures for exporting goods to new destinations.
Resolve disputes related to clearance, duties, or other customs-related issues with customs agencies.
Maintain knowledge of changes in regulations, laws, and industry standards impacting customs brokerage services.
Develop and implement strategic partnerships with carriers, suppliers, and other stakeholders to improve client service.
Prepare and submit cargo insurance documents on behalf of clients for export shipments.
Verify the authenticity and integrity of client-provided documentation and reports.
Coordinate with customs agencies to resolve any issues related to detention or hold releases.
1: Design, develop, and implement comprehensive training programs to enhance employees' skills and knowledge.
Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps and prioritize training initiatives.
Create and manage budgets for training programs, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to design and deliver specialized training content.
Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs, collecting data on participant feedback and skill acquisition.
Develop and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers to source training materials and services.
Coordinate logistics for large-scale training events, including venue selection and catering arrangements.
Provide coaching and mentoring support to employees to enhance their transferable skills and knowledge sharing.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices, applying this knowledge to inform training programs and initiatives.
Develop and implement assessment strategies to measure employee learning outcomes and track progress over time.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership, advocating for training investments that align with organizational goals.
2: Prepare menu items to meet daily nutritional standards for institutional clients.
Operate commercial kitchen equipment safely and efficiently to minimize food waste and optimize productivity.
Maintain accurate inventory records of ingredients and supplies to ensure adequate stock levels and minimize ordering costs.
Coordinate menu planning with registered dietitians or nutritionists to develop balanced meal options.
Assist in the ordering, receipt, and storage of perishable ingredients and supplies to ensure timely delivery.
Clean and sanitize kitchen surfaces, equipment, and utensils according to sanitation standards and regulations.
Monitor and control food temperatures during preparation, storage, and serving to prevent bacterial contamination.
Prepare salads, soups, and other cold dishes according to institutional menus and recipes.
Use menu engineering principles to minimize food costs while maintaining quality and profitability.
Develop and implement recipes and meal plans for special dietary groups such as vegan, gluten-free, or low-sodium.
Manage inventory of cooking oils, condiments, and spices to ensure adequate stock levels and minimize waste.
Collaborate with other culinary staff members to achieve efficient service during peak periods.
